entry.title: Re: Highlights of Transportation Management in SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition 20
entry.content:
Looking very much forward to the integration of with TM with Lean Service Procurement for providing even more visibility into a company's freight charges.

Indeed not only one of the most important highlights of this release - in my opinion, it promises to be one of the biggest highlight regarding Freight Settlement in years.

entry.title: SAP Sales Cloud V2 Sales Quotation : September 2025 Edition
entry.content:
This month, Sales Quote features are designed to streamline your workflow, maximize deal value, and ensure clean data synchronization.  we are bringing you a quick roundup of the key innovations in Sales Quotation processes: what they are, why they matter, and how they can make a real difference in your day-to-day work.

 

1. Product Recommendations using Product List

Ready to stop leaving money on the table? Now, you can proactively increase your deal size by defining Cross-Sell, Up-Sell, and Down-Sell products directly in your Product Lists. When you're creating a quote, these insights appear instantly, empowering you to maximize value without interrupting your workflow.

Why It Matters:

Sales reps are proactively guided to maximize deal value and improve win rates. This feature helps you increase your deal size through contextual recommendations, whether you're recommending a complementary product (Cross-Sell), a higher-tier alternative (Up-Sell), or a simpler option when a customer is hesitant (Down-Sell).

Getting Started

  1. Define Product List Recommendations: When creating a product list, select the new "Recommendation" type to define your cross-sell, up-sell, and down-sell items.
  2. Apply Recommendations: Within the product line item on a Sales Quote, use the additional “Insights” option to add the recommended items. (Note: The "Insights" field must be added via adaptation ).

2. Consistency Check

Have you ever needed to save a quote to come back to later, even if it had a small, tolerable error? Now you can! Sales reps can save a quote as an inconsistent quote. Plus, there's a new "Check Consistency" action to help you check for errors before you even hit save. Just remember: an inconsistent quote cannot be submitted or used to create an order.

Why It Matters

This new check ensures both data retention and process integrity, giving you flexibility without compromising compliance down the line.

Getting Started

  1. Enable the action "Check Consistency" via adaptation.
  2. Also, enable the "consistency status" and "consistency checked on" fields within the sales quote header.

3. Sort Option within Add Products from Past Quotes

Imagine a repeat customer asking for “the same as last time.” Now, when you pull products directly from past sales quotes with the account , you can quickly sort the quotes based on ID, Description, or Created Date. Stop scrolling and start quoting!

Why It Matters : This simple update significantly enhances quote creation efficiency.

Getting Started : This feature will be available by default within the "Add from Past Sales Quotes" option of the sales quote product table.

4. Campaign Reference

Now you can close the loop on your marketing efforts! A Campaign can now be directly associated as a reference to sales quotes. If the quote follows up an opportunity, the campaign copies over , and you can see the association right in the related objects section.

Why It Matters: This allows Sales Representatives to use the quote conversion and "won" data to help you determine the campaign effectiveness.

Getting Started: The Campaign field can be added into the sales quote header via adaptation.

 

5. Autoflow Actions

You can now automate key quote actions using Autoflows. Set up flows for Simulate, Submit for Approval, and Withdrawal from Approval based on predefined conditions. This means less manual clicking for your sales team and faster processing for your quotes.

Why It Matters

Automating these standard processes saves sales representatives time and ensures quotes move forward consistently, improving overall process efficiency and compliance.

Getting Started : Admins can set up autoflows for these actions based on available conditions in the system.

6. Other Notable Enhancements

  • Email: Additional option with both in -app email and local client email is now supported directly from the involved party card
  • Account Sales Quote History: Account Sales Quotes History now supports below additional functionalities
    • Search
    • Create
    • Table view in Collapsed view with view switcher
    • Adaptation flexibility

We release updates every month to continuously enhance your experience. To see what we shipped last month, check out the August Sales Quotes Update Link

entry.title: How to get the Inventory Value for the Free of Charge Materials
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

Currently, We are purchasing the material from vendor and also we are receiving the for Free of Charge(FOC) for the same material. Now customer wants to track the inventory value of the materials which are received for free of cost.  

I am suggesting to create the new material for the FOC and perform the Goods Receipt with Movement Type 501. 

Is this design is suggestable or there are any other options in SAP to view the Inventory Value for FOC materials. 

Please suggest.

Thanks in advance.

entry.content:

I'm trying to get information about data providers using the sdk.

To do this, I'm initializing the report engine. 

// Initialize Webi report engine 
ReportEngines reportEngines = (ReportEngines)enterpriseSession.getService("ReportEngines"); 
ReportEngineType type = ReportEngines.ReportEngineType.WI_REPORT_ENGINE; 

ReportEngine reportEngine = (ReportEngine) reportEngines.getService(type);

entry.title: Re: Unable to trigger planning sequence through Scripts(B...
entry.content:
@Fasi22 

The API syntax is as below.

//Sets the variable values of a planning sequence.
BpcPlanningSequence.getBpcPlanningSequenceDataSource().setVariableValue(variable: string | VariableInfo, variableValue: string | number | VariableValue JSON | VariableValue[] JSON, options?: SetVariableValueOptions JSON): void

If the parameters are not provided in right format, it may error out. Its either a string or an array of string [ ]. If you want json format just check if the format is correct.

PS_1.getBpcPlanningSequenceDataSource().setVariableValue("0PLANT", ["P100", "P200"]);

have not tried json format but it should be as below.

PS_1.getBpcPlanningSequenceDataSource().setVariableValue("0COSTCENTER": ["CC1000", "CC2000", "CC3000"]);

Check the format of Unique_MS1 and other variables.

Hope this helps !

Nikhil

entry.title: Anatomy of a Function Module: POPUP_TO_CONFIRM
entry.content:
This is a four-part series about the function module POPUP_TO_CONFIRM, originally published in the Application Development and Automation Blog Posts group. The series includes six campfire stories, with two stories featured in each of the following posts.

  • Part 1 - Introduction, Discovery, Function Interface, Flow Logic
    • What is POPUP_TO_CONFIRM?
    • The Moment I Feel a Journey Approaching
    • Experiment: Newline Character and HTML <br> Tag
    • Function Interface (Parameters)
    • Flow Logic
  • Part 2 - Stories: Changing the Popup Icon, Customizing the Icons and Quick Info Buttons
    • Story 1: Changing the Popup Icon
    • Story 2: Customizing the Icons and Quick Info of Buttons
  • Part 3 - Stories: Splitting Text into 48- and 57-Char Sentences and Starting on New Lines
    • Story 3: Splitting Text into 48-Char Sentences and Starting on New Lines
    • Story 4: Splitting Text into 57-Char Sentences and Starting on New Lines
  • Part 4 - Stories: Displaying an Unordered List, Displaying Longer Text Using a Document Object
    • Story 5: Displaying an Unordered List
    • Story 6: Displaying Longer Text Using a Document Object

entry.title: Re: Onboarding question for the 2H 2025 Product Release T...
entry.content:
@EVThomas this feature majorily introduced to handle employer section in compliance forms where details of onboardee which not captured part of NHDR/PDC step .(ex: Compensation,benefit insurance,country specific details..etc)

Below is flow :

1.Onboardee fill compliance tile .

2.Responsible user(as per configuration for employer) will complete compliance task for employer section from "To-Do"section

3.E-sign will trigger for onboardee.

4.Esign will trigger for employer.

Hope above flows clarifies your query and this feature introduced only for 3 below forms in this release:

  • India Form 11
  • Canada TD1-IN
  • US WTPA forms

Thanks,

Gopi

entry.title: Inquiry Regarding Removal of TCD: SU01 from Authorization Object S_TCODE
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Personnel,

 

I would like to remove TCD: SU01 from the Authorization Object: S_TCODE for a specific role.
However, since the object containing TCD: SU01 is part of the standard configuration, it cannot be deleted directly.
I would appreciate your guidance on the following two points:

 

1.When Authorization Object: S_TCODE is standard, is removing the SU01 node from
PFCG > Menu > Hierarchy > Role Menu the only way to delete the transaction?

 

2.After removing the node and updating the profile, several authorization objects were added or suggested in the Authorization Data.
Could you please advise on a simple method to compare the authorizations before and after the profile update?

 

Thanks and best regards,
A.

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Inquiry Regarding Removal of TCD: SU01 from Authoriza...
entry.content:
Dear Sir,

 

If the value SU01 is part of an s_tcode authorization with status 'Standard', the only way to remove it is, to remove that t-code from the menu of the role. 

After that change is saved on the menu tab of PFCG, the status of the authorization tab turns red. That means, that menu change requires a merge of the authorizations.
Now the rules of SAP note #113290 are important to understand, what happens during the merge.

After the merge it is possible to identify the changes on one hand by checking the status of the existing authorizations ('new', 'updated'), and on the other hand, deleted authorizations can be found when using the ALV-tree display on the right screen of the split screen. The ALV-tree display can be activated on the authorization maintenance screen, in the menu->Utilities->Settings.

Alternatively, simply open the authorizations tab of the role in display mode in a different GUI-mode, then perform the merge in the first mode and compare the result with the second mode.

 

b.rgds, Bernhard

entry.title: How to enter Attribute on aggregated level to get it then populated to detailed in SAP IBP?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

is there an option in SAP IBP for the user to enter the value for the attribute on aggregated level?

lets say user wants to fill in attribute (AaKF) of Location product of same value for different locations, so for location 101 all values of attr are 500, for location 102 all values are 300 etc

so what he needs to enter is only two values:

LOCID       DESIREDATTR

101           500

102           300

All prod-loc combinations of location 101 should get 500. All prod-loc combinationsof location 102 should get 300.

Is there any way for that? 

Thank you!

BR, Halyna

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere - Replication Flow (Delta Functionality)
entry.content:
pay attention that the HANA connection creates triggers directly on the source table.

if you add a column the trigger goes into error and will lock the table for DML statements!!!

a better solution is to create a CDS view and expose it as ODP. 

in this way the delta is managed by the BW applicaiton server rather than the database and if you modify the source it does not invalidate CDC triggers.

so a CDS view that read directly the base tables of the IOBJ or ADSO, read thourgh ODP via RFC instead of ODBC directly to tables is more robust.

entry.title: Re: VS Code SAP WEB CLIENT Extensibility
entry.content:
Hello Prasanth,

First of all, thank you for your detailed response.
It was very clear, and the samples were perfect to help us understand your explanation.
We are really trying to change our mindset towards the Web Client, but some things are still not very clear at these initial stages.

Regarding the "bait and switch" solution — you might not believe it, but this was exactly (step by step) what we did! We hid the native "Save" button, added our own "Save" button, performed our validations when it was pressed, and after that we called the SAP "Save" method.

That was our Plan B if there was no other solution... so we weren’t as far off as we thought!

Thank you very much!

entry.title: NWBC Error after Patch Implementation - Wrong caching in NWBC_NAV_TREE
entry.content:
Since the last patch implementation in our (clinical) system with severeal dialog instances and an integrated Web Dispatcher, we have been experiencing an issue when using NWBC.

When launching a tile, the following error may occur:

partner ‘hostname:port’ not reached
WASECONNREFUSED: Connection refused
Would you like a detailed error description?

It is noticeable that the hostname:port combination shown in the error message is incorrect — it’s a mix of two correct values:

The hostname always refers to the server where the user was previously logged in.

The port value, however, correctly refers to the current server where the user is logged in.

We were able to narrow the issue down to what seems to be a faulty cache.

After running the report /UI2/INVALIDATE_GLOBAL_CACHES, which among other things clears the table NWBC_NAV_TREE, the issue disappears — but only temporarily. The first login to the initial dialog instance works fine. However, after logging into a different dialog instance, the error reappears.

We have had an open ticket with SAP for over two weeks now, but unfortunately, support has not yet understood the problem. We repeatedly receive suggestions pointing to a supposed network configuration or connection issue. The problem has been described in detail in writing and with screenshots; earlier today I even explained it in a Teams call. After one hour, the support engineer asked for the output of

niping -v -h hostname — without specifying from which host to which this should be executed. Two escalations have not improved the situation.

Since the beginning of this week, we are working with a temporary workaround:

A custom enhancement deletes the user-specific entries in table NWBC_NAV_TREE whenever a tile is clicked.

The following patches were implemented:
IS-H 618: SP 43
HR 608: SP 145 → 148
EA-HR 608: SP 145 → 148
SAP_GWFND 750 SP33
SAP_BASIS 750 SP33
SAP_ABA 750 SP33
SAP_BW 750 SP33
SAP_UI 754 SP17

Has anyone experienced a similar or identical issue?

Thanks
Matthias

entry.title: Re: How to get the Inventory Value for the Free of Charge...
entry.content:
Creating a separate material for Free of Charge (FOC) items and posting with movement type 501 is a valid approach, but SAP offers alternative methods that may better support valuation tracking without duplicating material master data.

Below are the recommended options

With Valuation Type, you can distinguish FOC stock from purchased stock. One valuation type for purchased stock and another for FOC stock. This allows tracking inventory value separately while using the same material.

Create a PO with FOC indicator (checkbox in PO item). GR is posted with movement type 101, but no value is posted. Inventory quantity increases, but valuation remains unaffected.

Add a statistical condition (e.g., NR00) to indicate FOC value. Helps in reporting and audit trails without affecting actual valuation.
 
For valuation reporting, use FIFO valuation app or moving average price to reflect actual consumption and cost trends. Helps in understanding how FOC stock affects overall inventory value. Please go through this SAP Help FIFO Valuation

entry.title: Re: Implement Internal Order objects with budget control...
entry.content:
I’d like to provide clarity regarding the availability of Internal Orders in S/4HANA Public Cloud systems. Please note that Internal Orders are no longer supported in S/4HANA Public Cloud systems. From the SAP Help Portal: CO - Internal order (restricted)  

As an alternative, the recommended solution is to use Enterprise Projects, which can be managed using applications such as Project Control - Enterprise Projects and Project Planning.

Additionally, if you wish to utilize the Budget Availability Control for Projects feature included in Enterprise Projects, you can do so by working with Statistical or Overhead Projects. For further guidance and detailed documentation, you can explore the SAP Help Portal using the following link:

SAP Help Portal:
Project Control - Enterprise Projects
Budget Availability Control for Projects

I have created a separated project for the migration object Product - extend existing record by new org levels and tried to upload a file with several materials and plants, but I get an error message from the app. I made a test with 3 materials that need to be extended in 3 different plants, so I created 9 lines, each one with a different RUN ID. Only one line per material has been simulated correctly, the other lines have been skipped to avoid multiple updates on same target instance. 

Do I have to prepare one file per plant? Or is there another way to centralize all the records in one file?

Thank you in advance.

Best regards,

Ornella

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Error during Upload of Pages
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
i have the following issue when trying to upload pages in a new starter customizing tenant.
What i wanted to do, was export custom pages from a different tenant which is part of internal system environment and import them in a new starter customizing tenant for workshops.
The system tells me that the pages cant be uploaded and this is the error message:

I think the issue is, that the system i downloaded the pages from, has german as its original language and the starter customizing system usually have english as the original language. 

My question is, can i do anything to solve this ? I tried changing some language keys from "DE" to "EN" in the json file that is imported, but this only results in the same error but with the translation "English(EN)" instead of "German(DE)" (compare screenshot).
Where can i even check what the original language of the tenant is ?

Best regards 
Lukas

entry.title: Re: Send default HTTP200 from SAP APIM
entry.content:
Hi Diptee, what exactly is meant with "irrespective of the backend response (error or success)."

1) There are HTTP status codes: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_HTTP_status_codes
Is the requirement to always return 200  instead of 400, 401, 404, 500, ...?
If so, this is a bad requirement. It is a violation against the HTTP protocol and makes error analysis difficult, cumbersome, impossible.

2) You have errors while processing the request in your application (CPI iFlows). Then, the request was transferred correctly and you could return 200 e.g. with error messages in the response body.
My opinion, not a good idea, the client does not notice, that there was an issue. All frameworks would just take the response and were happy with it. The client application must take over error handling completely. I would return something from the 400 codes.
Same as in 1) applies here: makes error analysis difficult, cumbersome, impossible.

entry.title: SAP Fiori Elements Funktion Import Copy Row
entry.content:
I have a Fiori Elements app with a list report page and an object page. When I click the Copy one Row button on the list report page, a new row with the same values as the selected row is created. I am then automatically redirected to the object page, where I can edit the data in the new row. However, when I click Cancel, the new row is still displayed in the list even though I have not saved the data. How can I prevent this behavior?

  METHOD /iwbep/if_mgw_appl_srv_runtime~execute_action.
    DATA : ls_parameter        TYPE /iwbep/s_mgw_name_value_pair,
           ls_zleiter_ausnahme TYPE zleiter_ausnahme,
           ls_result           TYPE zleiter_ausnahme,
           ls_entity           TYPE  zcl_zodata_leiter_aus_mpc=>ts_leiterausnahmen,
           lt_entityset        TYPE zcl_zodata_leiter_aus_mpc=>tt_leiterausnahmen.

    IF iv_action_name = 'CopyRow'.

      "read parameters
      READ TABLE it_parameter INTO ls_parameter WITH KEY name = 'LA_ID'.
      READ TABLE it_parameter INTO DATA(ls_keys_app) WITH KEY name = 'APP_ID'.
      ls_zleiter_ausnahme-la_id = ls_parameter-value.
      ls_zleiter_ausnahme-app_id = ls_keys_app-value.


      "select new values
      "do you know - even if you haven't yet committed the changes,
      "system will return new data
      "search 'transaction isolation levels' to read more on this
      SELECT SINGLE * FROM zleiter_ausnahme
        WHERE  la_id = @LS_zleiter_ausnahme-la_id AND app_id = @LS_zleiter_ausnahme-app_id
        INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF @LS_result .
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        SELECT MAX( la_id ) FROM zleiter_ausnahme INTO @DATA(lv_id).
        ADD 1 TO lv_id.
        ls_result-la_id = lv_id.
        ls_result-la_datum = sy-datum.
        ls_result-la_aenderer = sy-uname.
     MODIFY zleiter_ausnahme FROM ls_result.

        DATA: ls_entityset LIKE LINE OF lt_entityset.

*      ls_entityset-aenderer = ls_result-la_aenderer.
        ls_entityset-aenderer = sy-uname.
        ls_entityset-bemerkung = ls_result-la_bemerkung.
*      ls_entityset-date = ls_result-la_datum.
        ls_entityset-date = sy-datum.
        ls_entityset-datefrom = ls_result-la_datum_von.
        ls_entityset-dateto = ls_result-la_datum_bis.
        ls_entityset-int2 = ls_result-la_id.
        ls_entityset-kostl = ls_result-la_kostl.
        ls_entityset-ktr = ls_result-la_ktr.
        ls_entityset-mandt = ls_result-mandt.
        ls_entityset-username = ls_result-la_nutzer.
        ls_entityset-int1 = ls_result-app_id.
        ls_entityset-app_description = ls_result-app_bezeichnung.

      APPEND ls_entityset TO lt_entityset.

* call methos copy_data_to_ref and export entity set data
        copy_data_to_ref( EXPORTING is_data = ls_entityset

                CHANGING cr_data = er_data ).
      ELSE.
        "Fehlerbehandlung - Quellrecord nicht gefunden
        RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception
          EXPORTING
            textid  = /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception=>business_error
            message = 'Quelldatensatz nicht gefunden'.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF .
**TRY.
*CALL METHOD SUPER->/IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME~EXECUTE_ACTION
**  EXPORTING
**    iv_action_name          =
**    it_parameter            =
**    io_tech_request_context =
**  IMPORTING
**    er_data                 =
*    .
** CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception .
** CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_tech_exception .
**ENDTRY.
  ENDMETHOD.

entry.title: Fiori Elements: How to achieve Dynamic Tab Values in Overview Page Cards
entry.content:
I have a requirement to show Sales Contracts as a card on Overview Page. Each Sales Contract has a Status (Open, Complete, Closed, etc.). The values of Status are customized by the user and we do not know them upfront.

My requirement is to show tabs with status in the List Card. The end result would look something like this:

Overview Page List Card:

Tabs configured using Selection Variant:

Coding done for configuring these tabs with Static Values:

Card:

"card_Quotation": {
        "template": "sap.ovp.cards.list",
        "model": "mainModel",
        "settings": {
          "entitySet": "xHZBxI_QuotesInDashboard",
          "title": "Angebote",
          "tabs": [
            {
              "annotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem#QuotationsLIQ",
              "selectionAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant#QuotationsOpenSVQ",
              "identificationAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Identification#QuotationIDQ",
              "value": "in Erstellung"
            },
            {
              "annotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem#QuotationsLIQ",
              "selectionAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant#QuotationsPricingSVQ",
              "identificationAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Identification#QuotationIDQ",
              "value": "in Preisanfrage"
            },
            {
              "annotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem#QuotationsLIQ",
              "selectionAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant#QuotationsQuotedVQ",
              "identificationAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Identification#QuotationIDQ",
              "value": "Angeboten"
            },
            {
              "annotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem#QuotationsLIQ",
              "selectionAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionVariant#QuotationsAcceptedSVQ",
              "identificationAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.Identification#QuotationIDQ",
              "value": "Angenommen"
            }
          ],
          "sortBy": "QuotationID",
          "sortOrder": "descending",
          "listFlavor": "standard",
          "listType": "condensed"
        }
      },

XML Annotations:

 

<Annotations Target="cds_xhzbxcustomer.xHZBxI_QuotesInDashboardType">
                <Annotation Term="UI.LineItem" Qualifier="QuotationsLIQ">
                    <Collection>
                        <Record Type="UI.DataField">
                            <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="QuotationID"/>
                            <Annotation Term="UI.Importance" EnumMember="UI.ImportanceType/Low"/>
                        </Record>
                        <Record Type="UI.DataField">
                            <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="Description"/>
                            <Annotation Term="UI.Importance" EnumMember="UI.ImportanceType/High"/>
                        </Record>
                        <Record Type="UI.DataField">
                            <PropertyValue Property="Value" Path="StatusDescription"/>
                            <Annotation Term="UI.Importance" EnumMember="UI.ImportanceType/Medium"/>
                        </Record>
                    </Collection>
                </Annotation>
                <Annotation Term="UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="QuotationsOpenSVQ">
                    <Record>
                        <PropertyValue Property="SelectOptions">
                            <Collection>
                                <Record Type="UI.SelectOptionType">
                                    <PropertyValue Property="PropertyName" PropertyPath="Status"/>
                                    <PropertyValue Property="Ranges">
                                        <Collection>
                                            <Record Type="UI.SelectionRangeType">
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Sign" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeSignType/I"/>
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Option" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeOptionType/EQ"/>
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Low" String="E0001"/>
                                            </Record>
                                        </Collection>
                                    </PropertyValue>
                                </Record>
                            </Collection>
                        </PropertyValue>
                    </Record>
                </Annotation>
                <Annotation Term="UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="QuotationsPricingSVQ">
                    <Record>
                        <PropertyValue Property="SelectOptions">
                            <Collection>
                                <Record Type="UI.SelectOptionType">
                                    <PropertyValue Property="PropertyName" PropertyPath="Status"/>
                                    <PropertyValue Property="Ranges">
                                        <Collection>
                                            <Record Type="UI.SelectionRangeType">
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Sign" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeSignType/I"/>
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Option" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeOptionType/EQ"/>
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Low" String="E0002"/>
                                            </Record>
                                        </Collection>
                                    </PropertyValue>
                                </Record>
                            </Collection>
                        </PropertyValue>
                    </Record>
                </Annotation>
                <Annotation Term="UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="QuotationsAcceptedSVQ">
                    <Record>
                        <PropertyValue Property="SelectOptions">
                            <Collection>
                                <Record Type="UI.SelectOptionType">
                                    <PropertyValue Property="PropertyName" PropertyPath="Status"/>
                                    <PropertyValue Property="Ranges">
                                        <Collection>
                                            <Record Type="UI.SelectionRangeType">
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Sign" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeSignType/I"/>
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Option" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeOptionType/EQ"/>
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Low" String="E0006"/>
                                            </Record>
                                        </Collection>
                                    </PropertyValue>
                                </Record>
                            </Collection>
                        </PropertyValue>
                    </Record>
                </Annotation>
                <Annotation Term="UI.SelectionVariant" Qualifier="QuotationsQuotedSVQ">
                    <Record>
                        <PropertyValue Property="SelectOptions">
                            <Collection>
                                <Record Type="UI.SelectOptionType">
                                    <PropertyValue Property="PropertyName" PropertyPath="Status"/>
                                    <PropertyValue Property="Ranges">
                                        <Collection>
                                            <Record Type="UI.SelectionRangeType">
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Sign" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeSignType/I"/>
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Option" EnumMember="UI.SelectionRangeOptionType/EQ"/>
                                                <PropertyValue Property="Low" String="E0004"/>
                                            </Record>
                                        </Collection>
                                    </PropertyValue>
                                </Record>
                            </Collection>
                        </PropertyValue>
                    </Record>
                </Annotation>
                <Annotation Term="UI.Identification" Qualifier="QuotationIDQ">
                    <Collection>
                        <Record Type="UI.DataFieldForIntentBasedNavigation">
                            <PropertyValue Property="SemanticObject" String="xhzbxQuotations"/>
                            <PropertyValue Property="Action" String="manage"/>
                            <PropertyValue Property="Label" String="App öffnen"/>
                            <Annotation Term="UI.Importance" EnumMember="UI.ImportanceType/High"/>
                        </Record>
                    </Collection>
                </Annotation>
            </Annotations>

As you can see in the XML annotations, I was giving static values such as E0001, E0002, etc. But how do I achieve the same affect without using static values.

Below is my CDS view:

define view entity /HZB/I_Contract
  as select from /HZB/R_Quotation as crmobject
    inner join   /hzb/c_stat_bus  as status_crmobj_mapping on  crmobject.Status     =  status_crmobj_mapping.status
                                                           and status_crmobj_mapping.objecttype <> 'BUS2000116'
{
  key crmobject.GUID,
      crmobject.QuotationID,
      crmobject.ObjectType,
      crmobject.ProcessType,
      crmobject.Description,
      crmobject.Status,
      crmobject.StatusSelFldVH,
      crmobject.StatusSchema,
      crmobject.StatusDescription,
      crmobject.SoldToParty as Customer,
      crmobject.SoldToPartyName,
      crmobject.ResponsibleEmployee,
      crmobject.ResponsibleEmployeeName,
      crmobject.ContactPerson,
      crmobject.ContactPersonName,
      crmobject.CreatedOn,
      crmobject.ChangedOn,
      crmobject.CreatedOnDate,
      crmobject.ChangedOnDate,
      crmobject.CreatedBy,
      crmobject.ChangedBy,
      /* Associations */
      crmobject._Appointments,
      crmobject._Attachments,
      crmobject._ContactPerson,
      crmobject._Item,
      crmobject._ResponsibleEmployee,
      crmobject._SoldToParty,
      crmobject._Status
}

entry.title: 5 pontos essenciais para o fechamento da fase DEPLOY em projetos SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
entry.content:
A fase DEPLOY é o momento mais esperado de toda a jornada SAP Activate — é onde a solução finalmente entra em operação. Mas o sucesso dessa virada depende de um encerramento bem estruturado, capaz de garantir uma transição estável, usuários treinados e governança ativa para o período pós-Go-Live.

O fechamento dessa etapa não representa apenas o final do projeto, mas o início de uma nova fase: a adoção contínua e sustentável da solução SAP.

O Roadmap da metodologia SAP Activate apresenta informações bem completas para apoio nesse momento. Mas caso precise de um guia para referência rápida, deixo abaixo os 5 pontos chave que devem ser considerados neste momento. Como mais referências, deixo ao final deste post o link para o Roadmap completo.

A seguir, compartilho os 5 pontos principais que devem ser observados no encerramento do DEPLOY:

1. Go-Live Executado e Estabilização Iniciada

O Go-Live deve ocorrer com acompanhamento próximo da equipe do projeto e foco total em estabilidade.

  • Transição planejada conforme o Cutover Plan

  • Suporte ativo nos primeiros dias de operação (Hypercare)

  • Monitoramento contínuo de incidentes e performance

Esse é o momento de transformar planejamento em resultados concretos.

2. Processos Operacionais Estabilizados

O sistema deve estar operando de forma estável e dentro dos padrões de negócio definidos.

  • Processos críticos testados em ambiente produtivo

  • Indicadores de performance acompanhados

  • Correções emergenciais tratadas e controladas

O objetivo aqui é confirmar que a operação está pronta para seguir sem dependência total da equipe de projeto.

3. Treinamento e Suporte ao Usuário Final

O sucesso do Go-Live também depende da adoção pelos usuários.

  • Treinamentos realizados e documentados

  • Materiais de apoio disponíveis (manuais, FAQs, tutoriais)

  • Canal de suporte ativo e responsivo

Sem capacitação adequada, até a melhor solução perde eficiência.

4. Encerramento Formal do Projeto

Todo projeto SAP deve ter um encerramento administrativo e técnico formal.

  • Lições aprendidas documentadas (Lessons Learned)

  • Aprovação do cliente e aceite formal (Project Closure)

  • Atualização do portfólio de riscos e entregáveis

Esse é o marco que confirma a conclusão bem-sucedida do projeto e libera as equipes para a fase de suporte contínuo.

5. Transição para Suporte e Operação Contínua

O handover entre o time de projeto e o time de sustentação é essencial para continuidade.

  • Processos, acessos e responsabilidades transferidos

  • Contratos e SLAs revisados e formalizados

  • Governança estabelecida para acompanhamento de incidentes e melhorias

Essa entrega garante que o sistema siga evoluindo com estabilidade e aderência ao conceito de Clean Core.

Conclusão

Encerrar bem a fase DEPLOY significa garantir que o Go-Live foi executado com sucesso, que os processos estão operando com estabilidade e que o cliente está preparado para a sustentação contínua.

Com transição estruturada, governança ativa e foco em adoção, o projeto consolida o valor entregue pelo SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, transformando implementação em resultados de negócio reais.

Link para o Roadmap SAP Activate relacionado a esta etapa:

https://me.sap.com/roadmapviewer/group/658F507A-D6F5-4B78-9EE1-0300C5F1E40F/roadmapcontentpage/a11ec6d657054bf9:FA163EAF25B21EEB8FC47DE9E728E8DB

entry.title: Re: Migrate photos to SAP WorkZone
entry.content:
Hi Olga,

 

As explained on KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/3242729, currently there is no way to mass upload photos to users profiles in Workzone. It is only possible manually on a per profile basis. 

Also it is currently not possible to Migrate and Import employee profile photo from SuccessFactors to WorkZone. But the product team is already working on a future enhancement to sync profiles images from SAP SuccessFactors to SAP Workzone, there's currently no target release for it yet and the KBA will be updated once the target date is provided. 

 

Kind Regards,

Cristian

entry.title: Re: Goods Receipt Reversal for External Procurement in EWM - SAP S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
Much needed feature in inbound area. 

Thanks for sharing!

-Dipak

entry.title: Re: Inactive user in RBP group
entry.content:
Hi Khaja20,

 

As per KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/2784357 it is an expected behavior for inactive users to be displayed on the Permission Group if it uses username People Pool filter. This is considered a static permission group and data is maintained manually by an admin.

Static Permission group always includes inactive users, as the target population may include inactive users depending on the organization's setup. This is the same for the search logic in Static Role-Based Permissions. If the end user was inactive before the group was created, it cannot be searched.

For static permission groups, what is seen is not the group membership but the group definition. Changes on the user data will not touch the group definition but the group membership. The group membership is the active group count which is seen on the upper hand right side of the permission group. It is always updated to include the active users only.

Please note that when granting permissions to users, only active users inherit the permissions. Hence, though an inactive user is listed, that user is never granted the role.

So the recommendation is to use dynamic groups and dynamic people pool filters on the permission group setup as these filters dynamically change based on the requirement and does not need manual maintenance on the admin's side. It automatically changes when the group filters and conditions are met. Inactive users will not be displayed as the group's criteria are updated automatically by the system.

 

Kind Regards,

Cristian

entry.title: 5 Essential Points for Successfully Closing DEPLOY in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Projects
entry.content:
The DEPLOY phase is the most anticipated moment in the SAP Activate methodology — it’s when the solution finally goes live and becomes part of the organization’s daily operations.
However, a successful Go-Live depends on a structured closure that ensures stability, user adoption, and active governance for the post-Go-Live phase.

Closing this stage marks not just the end of the project, but the beginning of a new journey: sustainable adoption and continuous value realization with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition.

The SAP Activate Methodology Roadmap provides comprehensive information to support this stage. However, if you need a quick reference guide, below are the 5 key points that should be considered at this moment. For additional references, I’ve included at the end of this post the link to the full Roadmap.

1. Go-Live Executed and Stabilization Initiated

The Go-Live should be executed with close coordination and full attention from the project team.

  • Transition completed according to the approved Cutover Plan

  • Active support during the first days (Hypercare)

  • Continuous monitoring of incidents and performance metrics

This is where the project truly delivers on its planning and effort.

2. Operational Processes Stabilized

The production system must be running smoothly and aligned with defined business standards.

  • Critical business processes validated in the production environment

  • Performance indicators actively monitored

  • Emergency fixes managed under controlled governance

The goal here is to ensure operations can continue reliably without constant project team intervention.

3. End-User Training and Support

The success of a Go-Live depends largely on user adoption.

  • End-user training sessions delivered and recorded

  • Support materials available (manuals, FAQs, tutorials)

  • Help desk and communication channels active

Even the best-designed solution can fail if end users are not well prepared.

4. Formal Project Closure

Every SAP project should end with a formal technical and administrative closure.

  • Lessons Learned documented and shared

  • Customer approval and official project sign-off

  • Risk register and deliverables updated

This milestone confirms the successful completion of the project and transitions ownership to the support organization.

5. Transition to Ongoing Support and Continuous Operations

A structured handover between the project team and the support organization is essential for business continuity.

  • Processes, access, and responsibilities formally transferred

  • Contracts and SLAs reviewed and confirmed

  • Governance established for continuous monitoring and improvement

This handover ensures the system continues to evolve under the Clean Core principle — stable, adaptable, and ready for innovation.

Conclusion

Successfully closing the DEPLOY phase means ensuring a stable Go-Live, well-trained users, and a seamless transition to continuous operations.

With structured transition, active governance, and focus on adoption, the project consolidates its value delivery through SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, transforming implementation into sustainable business outcomes.

Link to the SAP Activate Roadmap related to this phase:

https://me.sap.com/roadmapviewer/group/658F507A-D6F5-4B78-9EE1-0300C5F1E40F/roadmapcontentpage/a11ec6d657054bf9:FA163EAF25B21EEB8FC47DE9E728E8DB

entry.title: Stay Current with SAP SuccessFactors Succession Planning – 2H 2025
entry.content:
Hello SAP SuccessFactors Community!​

The second half of 2025 delivers focused enhancements in Succession Planning, expanding AI-assisted successor recommendations, standardizing APIs across nomination methods, tightening permission controls, and improving planner usability in the org chart and talent pools.​

This blog summarizes the key Succession updates with configuration tips, prerequisites, and why each change matters for scalable, governed talent planning.​

Succession highlights​

  1. OData V4 everywhere: NominationService.svc now supports role-person and legacy position-based methods, not just MDF, enabling create/update/delete for successors and pool nominations via a single API pattern.​

  2. AI-generated successors: Up to 10 recommended candidates based on job profiles, skills/competencies, and work history, with clear rationales and quick-add from the org chart or position tile.​

  3. Growth Portfolio intelligence: Suggested Successors calculates role readiness using Growth Portfolio proficiencies and explains matched vs. unmatched attributes aligned to Career Worksheet logic.​

  4. History access controls: Separate permissions for viewing nomination history of positions and talent pools improve governance and reporting/API alignment.​

  5. Smarter org chart sorting: Sort peers by position title or employee title for consistent, meaningful layouts tailored to the nomination method.​

  6. Include inactive employees: A new child setting lets target population logic include inactive users in talent pool workflows, cards, and searches.​

OData V4 API expansion​

Customers using role-person or legacy position-based nominations can use NominationService.svc (V4) to manage successor and talent pool nominations, standardizing integrations across methods.​

  • Why it matters: One service for all nomination models reduces custom logic and simplifies extensions and middleware flows.​

  • Permissions: Ensure Talent Pool view/edit/delete permissions align with intended API actions for pools and successors.​

AI-assisted successor recommendation​

Planners can trigger the Generate feature on the Succession Org Chart or Position Tile to receive recommendations based on job profile fit, skills, competencies, and job history. The results persist for three days and can be regenerated.​

  • Experience: See ranked suggestions with rationales, hover to quick-add as successors, and receive notifications when results are ready.​

  • Requirements: TIH with Growth Portfolio, AI units license with usage acknowledgment, enable Suggested Successors, activate via SAP support and AI Services Administration.​

In the suggested successors list, users can hover over an employee and use the Add button to nominate them as a successor. Once the employee is nominated, they are removed from the list. Users can also choose the information icon to view why the employee is suggested in a popover dialog.

The AI-generated content is stored on the position card for three days, after which it expires and becomes invisible. Users can regenerate the content at any time.

Here's a screenshot of this feature:

Suggested Successors enhancements​

Role readiness uses Growth Portfolio expected levels and actual proficiencies to compute readiness with an explanation of matched and unmatched attributes.​

  • UI changes: “Readiness” is renamed to “Role Readiness” in lists and dialogs to avoid confusion with general successor readiness status.​

  • Enablement: Turn on Suggested Successors to surface readiness explanations and Growth Portfolio-based calculations.​

  • Here's a screenshot of a role readiness explanation:

Nomination history permissions​

Two child permissions (for positions and for talent pools) provide fine-grained control over who can view nomination history, inheriting target population from parent permissions.​

  • Benefits: Protects sensitive changes, supports analysis through NomineeHistory (v2), and aligns visibility across cards, People Profile, and APIs.​

  • Rollout note: 2H 2025 grants corresponding history access to users of existing parent permissions by default.​

Org chart sorting options​

Admins can sort same-level nodes alphabetically by position title or employee title instead of username, improving planner orientation and report consistency.​

  • Configuration: Set Sort by position title for MDF/legacy position-based methods, or Sort by employee title for role-person method in Org Chart Configuration.​

  • Governance: Requires Manage System Properties for Org Chart Configuration.​

The following screenshots show the default sorting and the new sorting, respectively.

Succession Org Chart Sorted by Username (Default)

Inactive users in talent pools​

A new child option under “Apply target population to talent pool nominations” allows including inactive employees within the defined target population.​

  • Where it applies: Talent pools, position cards, talent card nomination sections, latest People Profile card/legacy block, and pool search results.​

  • Path: Admin Center > Nominations Setup > Apply target population to talent pool nominations > Include inactive users in the target population.​

Related PM/GM intersections to note​

  • AI writing expansion: AI-assisted writing actions now extend to goals, improving the quality and consistency of feedback that often feeds talent discussions.​

  • Governance and lifecycle: DRTM precision for goals and template self-service in Manage Templates help keep related performance data clean and configurable around succession cycles

Please feel free to share your ideas and questions in the comment box of this blog. I’d be glad to share what I know with you. Also, do share your thoughts on the latest changes, and the features you valued the most. Share this blog with your colleagues.

Thank you!!

The problem is the replication flow option it try an implicit cast from string to date. the default is "Native", you need to change it in Template. and then manage the cast in Datasphere if you need it.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_DATASPHERE/c8a54ee704e94e15926551293243fd1d/25e2bd7a70d44ac5b05e844f9e913471.html

entry.title: Re: Data migration from SAP C4C to ZOHO CRM system
entry.content:
Hello, 

With Migration let me assume you want to move a huge amount of data from Source(SAP C4C in this case) system to Target(ZOHO Crm) System,

If Yes,

Then this is something which you need to check at the Target end i.e. ZOHO Crm system, what kind of tools ZOHO Crm has provisioned for Data Migration. It's the same way we have Data Migration Cockpit at SAP End.

Now if the ask is just to push Transactional data in a real-time basis from SAP C4C to ZOHO CRM then you need to consume the APIs provided by ZOHO CRM inside SAP System, am sure they would be having a vast Portfolio of Standard REST and SOAP based APIs for various Transactions just the same way SAP has.

Thanks,

Sijin

entry.title: Poor Performance in RAP Managed Scenario with INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE
entry.content:
Hi developers,

we encountered a performance issue in a managed RAP scenario. In our usecase a large set of around 100.000 records with 19 columns is updated through a RAP action. Only 3 of the 19 columns are changed during the action and we mark these columns in the %control structure for each record. Our system is onpremise S/4HANA 2023.

We noticed that the update to the database takes over 2 minutes. We traced the db access. RAP utilizes the class CL_CSP_SQL_ACCESS to write the data to the database. The UPDATE statement uses the addition INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE %control.

The generated SQL statement send to the database looks like this:

UPDATE "DBTAB"
SET
"COLUMN1" = CASE ? WHEN 1 THEN ? ELSE "COLUMN1" END,
"COLUMN2" = CASE ? WHEN 1 THEN ? ELSE "COLUMN2" END,
...
WHERE "CLIENT" ...

 The whole statement is divided into smaller packages.  The execution time is around 160 seconds for all packages.

As a workaround we set our entity to with unmanaged save with full data. Then we implemented the UPDATE ourself in the save_modified method:

IF update-entity IS NO INITIAL.
  UPDATE dbtab FROM TABLE @update-entity MAPPING FROM ENTITY.
ENDIF.

 The execution time is now around 1 second for the whole UPDATE statement. The with full data addition costs another 1-2 seconds for reading the missing data.

We also tried unmanaged save without with full data and with added INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE %control which confirmed the poor performance of managed save.

There is another topic to this performance issue and a blog post about the INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE, but both are closed:

https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-discussions/performance-implications-of-using-quot-set-indicators-quot/td-p/12660187 

https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/abap-sql-indicator-structures/ba-p/13496401

@ SAP: Are there any plans to improve performance of INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE or the managed database access?

@ community: has anybody noticed the same behaviour or any suggestions how to avoid this?

best regards
Christian

entry.title: Re: Has Devtoberfest just proved that ABAP is in fact dead?

King regards
Thomas
